felt verb
(MAKE CLOTH)
[ T ] to make wool or other cloth into felt (= a thick, soft cloth made from a mass of fibres) by rolling and pressing it and using hot water or a special needle: I just finished felting a pair of mittens for the winter. a pile of felted blankets
More examplesFewer examplesHave you tried using a washing machine for felting wool? She picked up wool sweaters in charity shops and felted them with hot water in the washing machine.Asbestos fibres can be separated and woven into cloths or felted into sheets. Felted roofing needs regular supervision if it is to stay watertight once it's more than about 10 years old.
